posts.post_content: The option of flying or not can be used to avoid unexpected spells that kill either but not both (such as Hurricane and all the green flyer hate, or Earthquake and all the ground haters). Spectral Flight, of course, is still more useful in most situations.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: This card should not see play in any deck whatsoever. As ThisisSakon alluded to, if you have enough Blue mana to make your creature fly until end of turn, you might as well be using [Spectral Flight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Flight) instead. Pursuit of Flight is, I suppose, the very definition of a Limited filler card and makes Pauper players sad.

posts.post_content:
This is somewhat playable.  
  
Edit: after lots of online drafting this has become an absolute sleeper hit for me. Also pairs particularly well with [Ethereal Armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ethereal Armor) or [Deviant Glee](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deviant Glee). You can almost get away with drafting all three if you pick up some mana fixing.

Posted By: lorendorky (10/25/2012 2:15:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I agree with what Cyberium said, the option of flying is extremely useful, as it lets the creature avoid any flyer hate ([plummet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=plummet), [silk-lash spider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=silk-lash spider), [crash landing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=crash landing)) and lets it avoid ground-only cards ([rolling temblor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rolling temblor),[magmaquake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=magmaquake),[street spasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=street spasm)). However, in most cases [spectral flight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spectral flight) is better **if** it's a blue deck.
posts.html:
I agree with what Cyberium said, the option of flying is extremely useful, as it lets the creature avoid any flyer hate (plummet, silk-lash spider, crash landing) and lets it avoid ground-only cards (rolling temblor,magmaquake,street spasm). However, in most cases spectral flight is better if it's a blue deck.

Posted By: SIlverSkyz (12/19/2012 10:45:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I was told by someone in a recent RTR block draft that this card was shit and should only be run as an emergency 23rd spell. He certainly changed his tune after I put this on [Frostburn Weird](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frostburn Weird) two games in a row. Turns out there's not much of an answer to an 8/1 in the air. This is only a 2.5/5 since it's unplayable in Constructed, but in Limited it can prove deadly if you're not prepared. Another great target for this is [Trained Caracal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trained Caracal) if you can hit the right colors in your first few turns, though the kitty is a great target for Auras in general.
posts.html:
I was told by someone in a recent RTR block draft that this card was shit and should only be run as an emergency 23rd spell. He certainly changed his tune after I put this on Frostburn Weird two games in a row. Turns out there's not much of an answer to an 8/1 in the air. This is only a 2.5/5 since it's unplayable in Constructed, but in Limited it can prove deadly if you're not prepared. Another great target for this is Trained Caracal if you can hit the right colors in your first few turns, though the kitty is a great target for Auras in general.
